text: And ye shall not swear by My name falsely; neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbor, neither rob him. The wages of him that is hired shall not remain with thee all night until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling block before the blind, but shalt fear thy God: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment. Thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor honor the person of the mighty, but in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Thou shalt not go up and down as a talebearer among thy people; neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbor: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart. Thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbor, and not let sin come upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Ye shall keep My statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle breed with a diverse kind. Thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled seed; neither shall a garment mingled with linen and wool come upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And whosoever lieth carnally with a woman who is a bondmaid, betrothed to a husband, and not at all redeemed nor freedom given her, she shall be scourged. They shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the Lord, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: even a ram for a trespass offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the Lord for his sin which he hath done, and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And when ye shall come into the land and shall have planted all manner of trees for food, then ye shall count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised. Three years shall it be as uncircumcised unto you. It shall not be eaten of.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holy with which to praise the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the fifth year shall ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield unto you the increase thereof: I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood; neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe omens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not round off the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Do not prostitute thy daughter to cause her to be a whore, lest the land fall to whoredom and the land become full of wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My sanctuary: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Regard not those who have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards to be defiled by them: I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head and honor the face of the old man, and fear thy God: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not vex him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the stranger who dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself, for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in measuring length, weight, or number.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin shall ye have: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall ye observe all My statutes and all My judgments, and do them: I am the Lord.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, thou shalt say to the children of Israel: ‘Whosoever he be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers who sojourn in Israel, who giveth any of his seed unto Molech, he shall surely be put to death. The people of the land shall stone him with stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set My face against that man and will cut him off from among his people, because he hath given of his seed unto Molech, to defile My sanctuary and to profane My holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the people of the land do in any way hide their eyes from the man when he giveth of his seed unto Molech and kill him not,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will set My face against that man and against his family and will cut him off, and all who go a whoring after him to commit whoredom with Molech, from among their people.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And the soul that turneth after such as have familiar spirits and after wizards to go a whoring after them, I will even set My face against that soul and will cut him off from among his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Sanctify yourselves therefore and be ye holy, for I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And ye shall keep My statutes and do them: I am the Lord who sanctify you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘For every one that curseth his father or his mother shall be surely put to death. He hath cursed his father or his mother: his blood shall be upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And the man that committeth adultery with another man’s wife, even he that committeth adultery with his neighbor’s wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man that lieth with his father’s wife hath uncovered his father’s nakedness. Both of them shall surely be put to death: their blood shall be upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man lie with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall surely be put to death. They have wrought confusion: their blood shall be upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘If a man also lie with mankind as he lieth with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination. They shall surely be put to death: their blood shall be upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if a man take a wife and her mother, it is wickedness. They shall be burned with fire, both he and they, that there be no wickedness among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if a man lie with a beast, he shall surely be put to death; and ye shall slay the beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a woman approach unto any beast and lie down thereto, thou shalt kill the woman and the beast. They shall surely be put to death: their blood shall be upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if a man shall take his sister, his father’s daughter or his mother’s daughter, and see her nakedness and she see his nakedness, it is a wicked thing; and they shall be cut off in the sight of their people. He hath uncovered his sister’s nakedness: he shall bear his iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if a man shall lie with a woman having her sickness and shall uncover her nakedness, he hath discovered her fountain, and she hath uncovered the fountain of her blood; and both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother’s sister nor of thy father’s sister, for he uncovereth his near kin: they shall bear their iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man shall lie with his uncle’s wife, he hath uncovered his uncle’s nakedness. They shall bear their sin: they shall die childless.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man shall take his brother’s wife, it is an unclean thing. He hath uncovered his brother’s nakedness: they shall be childless.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Ye shall therefore keep all My statutes and all My judgments, and do them, that the land whither I bring you to dwell therein spew you not out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall not walk in the manners of the nation which I cast out before you; for they committed all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have said unto you, “Ye shall inherit their land, and I will give it unto you to possess it, a land that floweth with milk and honey.” I am the Lord your God, who have separated you from other people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall therefore put difference between clean beasts and unclean, and between unclean fowls and clean; and ye shall not make your souls abominable by beast or by fowl, or by any manner of living thing that creepeth on the ground, which I have separated from you as unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall be holy unto Me; for I the Lord am holy and have severed you from other people, that ye should be Mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘A man also or woman who hath a familiar spirit, or who is a wizard, shall surely be put to death. They shall stone them with stones: their blood shall be upon them.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, “Speak unto the priests the sons of Aaron, and say unto them: ‘There shall none be defiled for the dead among his people,
speaker: Narrator

text: except for his kin who is near unto him, that is: for his mother, and for his father, and for his son, and for his daughter, and for his brother,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for his sister, a virgin who is nigh unto him, who hath had no husband; for her may he be defiled.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not make baldness upon their head, neither shall they shave off the corner of their beard nor make any cuttings in their flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be holy unto their God and not profane the name of their God, for the offerings of the Lord made by fire and the bread of their God they do offer; therefore they shall be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not take a wife who is a whore or profane, neither shall they take a woman put away from her husband; for he is holy unto his God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt sanctify him therefore, for he offereth the bread of thy God. He shall be holy unto thee; for I the Lord, who sanctify you, am holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the daughter of any priest, if she profane herself by playing the whore, she profaneth her father. She shall be burned with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And he that is the high priest among his brethren, upon whose head the anointing oil was poured and who is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not uncover his head nor rend his clothes;
speaker: Narrator

text: neither shall he go in to any dead body, nor defile himself for his father or for his mother;
speaker: Narrator

text: neither shall he go out of the sanctuary nor profane the sanctuary of his God, for the crown of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall take a wife in her virginity.
speaker: Narrator

text: A widow or a divorced woman or profane or a harlot, these shall he not take; but he shall take a virgin of his own people for a wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall he profane his seed among his people, for I the Lord do sanctify him.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak unto Aaron, saying, ‘Whosoever he be of thy seed in their generations who hath any blemish, let him not approach to offer the bread of his God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whatsoever man he be that hath a blemish, he shall not approach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath a flat nose, or any thing superfluous,
speaker: Narrator

text: or a man who is brokenfooted, or brokenhanded,
speaker: Narrator

text: or crookbacked, or a dwarf, or who hath a blemish in his eye, or hath scurvy, or scabbed, or hath his stones broken—
speaker: Narrator

text: no man that hath a blemish of the seed of Aaron the priest shall come nigh to offer the offerings of the Lord made by fire. He hath a blemish: he shall not come nigh to offer the bread of his God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy and of the holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only he shall not go in unto the veil nor come nigh unto the altar, because he hath a blemish, that he profane not My sanctuaries; for I the Lord do sanctify them.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses told it unto Aaron and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, and that they profane not My holy name in those things which they hallow unto Me: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say unto them: ‘Whosoever he be of all your seed among your generations, who goeth unto the holy things which the children of Israel hallow unto the Lord, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from My presence: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatsoever man of the seed of Aaron is a leper or hath a running issue, he shall not eat of the holy things until he is clean. And whoso toucheth any thing that is unclean by the dead, or a man whose seed goeth from him,
speaker: Narrator

text: or whosoever toucheth any creeping thing whereby he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take uncleanness, whatsoever uncleanness he hath—
speaker: Narrator

text: the soul who hath touched any such shall be unclean until evening, and shall not eat of the holy things unless he wash his flesh with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sun is down he shall be clean, and shall afterwards eat of the holy things, because it is his food.
speaker: Narrator

text: That which dieth of itself or is torn with beasts, he shall not eat to defile himself therewith: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall therefore keep Mine ordinance, lest they bear sin for it and die therefore if they profane it: I the Lord do sanctify them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘There shall no stranger eat of the holy thing. A sojourner of the priest or a hired servant shall not eat of the holy thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the priest buy any soul with his money, he shall eat of it, and he that is born in his house; they shall eat of his meat.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the priest’s daughter also be married unto a stranger, she may not eat of an offering of the holy things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the priest’s daughter be a widow or divorced, and have no child, and is returned unto her father’s house as in her youth, she shall eat of her father’s meat; but there shall no stranger eat thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man eat of the holy thing unwittingly, then he shall put a fifth part thereof unto it, and shall give it unto the priest with the holy thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: or allow them to bear the iniquity of trespass when they eat their holy things: for I the Lord do sanctify them.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak unto Aaron and to his sons and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them: ‘Whosoever he be of the house of Israel or of the strangers in Israel, who will offer his oblation for all his vows and for all his freewill offerings, which they will offer unto the Lord for a burnt offering”
speaker: Narrator

text: ye shall offer at your own will a male without blemish of the beeves, of the sheep, or of the goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whatsoever hath a blemish, that shall ye not offer; for it shall not be acceptable for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whosoever offereth a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the Lord to accomplish his vow, or a freewill offering in beeves or sheep, it shall be perfect to be accepted; there shall be no blemish therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scurvy, or scabbed, ye shall not offer these unto the Lord, nor make an offering by fire of them upon the altar unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Either a bullock or a lamb that hath any thing superfluous or lacking in his parts, that mayest thou offer for a freewill offering, but for a vow it shall not be accepted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not offer unto the Lord that which is bruised, or crushed, or broken, or cut; neither shall ye make any offering thereof in your land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither from a stranger’s hand shall ye offer the bread of your God of any of these, because their corruption is in them and blemishes are in them; they shall not be accepted for you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “When a bullock or a sheep or a goat is brought forth, then it shall be seven days with its dam; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shall be accepted for an offering made by fire unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whether it be cow or ewe, ye shall not kill it and her young both in one day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the Lord, offer it at your own will.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the same day it shall be eaten up; ye shall leave none of it until the morrow: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore shall ye keep My commandments and do them: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall ye profane My holy name, but I will be hallowed among the children of Israel. I am the Lord who hallow you,
speaker: Narrator

text: that brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God: I am the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak unto the children of Israel and say unto them: ‘Concerning the feasts of the Lord, which ye shall proclaim to be holy convocations, even these are My feasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Six days shall work be done, but the seventh day is the Sabbath of rest, a holy convocation. Ye shall do no work therein; it is the Sabbath of the Lord in all your dwellings.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘These are the feasts of the Lord, even holy convocations, which ye shall proclaim in their seasons.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fourteenth day of the first month at evening is the Lord’S Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the fifteenth day of the same month is the Feast of Unleavened Bread unto the Lord; seven days ye must eat unleavened bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day ye shall have a holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the Lord seven days. On the seventh day is a holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work therein.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak unto the children of Israel and say unto them: ‘When ye come into the land which I give unto you and shall reap the harvest thereof, then ye shall bring a sheaf of the firstfruits of your harvest unto the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall wave the sheaf before the Lord to be accepted for you; on the morrow after the Sabbath the priest shall wave it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall offer that day when ye wave the sheaf a helamb without blemish of the first year for a burnt offering unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the meat offering thereof shall be two-tenths part of fine flour mingled with oil, an offering made by fire unto the Lord for a sweet savor; and the drink offering thereof shall be of wine, a fourth part of a hin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall eat neither bread nor parched corn nor green ears, until the selfsame day that ye have brought an offering unto your God; it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And ye shall count unto you from the morrow after the Sabbath, from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the wave offering; seven Sabbaths shall be complete.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even unto the morrow after the seventh Sabbath shall ye number fifty days, and ye shall offer a new meat offering unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall bring out of your habitations two wave loaves of two-tenths part. They shall be of fine flour; they shall be baked with leaven; they are the firstfruits unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall offer with the bread seven lambs without blemish of the first year, and one young bullock and two rams; they shall be for a burnt offering unto the Lord, with their meat offering and their drink offerings, even an offering made by fire, of sweet savor unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then ye shall sacrifice one kid of the goats for a sin offering, and two lambs of the first year for a sacrifice of peace offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest shall wave them with the bread of the firstfruits for a wave offering before the Lord with the two lambs; they shall be holy to the Lord for the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall proclaim on the selfsame day that it may be a holy convocation unto you. Ye shall do no servile work therein; it shall be a statute for ever in all your dwellings throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not rid cleanly the corners of thy field when thou reapest, neither shalt thou gather any gleanings of thy harvest. Thou shalt leave them unto the poor and to the stranger: I am the Lord your God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, ‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, a holy convocation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall do no servile work therein, but ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the Lord.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Also on the tenth day of this seventh month there shall be a Day of Atonement. It shall be a holy convocation unto you; and ye shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall do no work in that same day, for it is a Day of Atonement to make an atonement for you before the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whatsoever soul it be that shall not be afflicted in that same day, he shall be cut off from among his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whatsoever soul it be that doeth any work in that same day, the same soul will I destroy from among his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall do no manner of work; it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be unto you a sabbath of rest, and ye shall afflict your souls. On the ninth day of the month at evening, from evening unto evening, shall ye celebrate your sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, ‘The fifteenth day of this seventh month shall be the Feast of Tabernacles for seven days unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day shall be a holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven days ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the Lord. On the eighth day shall be a holy convocation unto you, and ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the Lord. It is a solemn assembly, and ye shall do no servile work therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘These are the feasts of the Lord which ye shall proclaim to be holy convocations, to offer an offering made by fire unto the Lord, a burnt offering and a meat offering, a sacrifice and drink offerings, every thing upon his day”
speaker: Narrator

text: besides the Sabbaths of the Lord, and besides your gifts, and besides all your vows, and besides all your freewill offerings which ye give unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Also on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when ye have gathered in the fruit of the land, ye shall keep a feast unto the Lord seven days; on the first day shall be a sabbath, and on the eighth day shall be a sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall take for yourselves on the first day the boughs of goodly trees, branches of palm trees, and the boughs of thick trees, and willows of the brook; and ye shall rejoice before the Lord your God seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall keep it a feast unto the Lord seven days in the year. It shall be a statute for ever in your generations; ye shall celebrate it in the seventh month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall dwell in booths seven days; all that are Israelites born shall dwell in booths,
speaker: Narrator

text: that your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dwell in booths when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses declared unto the children of Israel the feasts of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the children of Israel that they bring unto thee pure olive oil, beaten for the light, to cause the lamps to burn continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Outside the veil of the testimony, in the tabernacle of the congregation, shall Aaron order it from the evening unto the morning before the Lord continually; it shall be a statute for ever in your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall order the lamps upon the pure candlestick before the Lord continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And thou shalt take fine flour and bake twelve cakes thereof, twotenths part shall be in one cake.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set them in two rows, six on a row, upon the pure table before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put pure frankincense upon each row, that it may be on the bread for a memorial, even an offering made by fire unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every Sabbath he shall set it in order before the Lord continually, being taken from the children of Israel by an everlasting covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be Aaron’s and his sons’; and they shall eat it in the holy place, for it is most holy unto him of the offerings of the Lord made by fire by a perpetual statute.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son of an Israelite woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel; and this son of the Israelite woman and a man of Israel strove together in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Israelite woman’s son blasphemed the name of the Lord and cursed. And they brought him unto Moses (his mother’s name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan);
speaker: Narrator

text: and they put him under guard, that the mind of the Lord might be shown them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Bring forth him that hath cursed outside the camp; and let all who heard him lay their hands upon his head, and let all the congregation stone him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, ‘Whosoever curseth his God shall bear his sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that blasphemeth the name of the Lord, he shall surely be put to death, and all the congregation shall certainly stone him. As well the stranger as he that is born in the land, when he blasphemeth the name of the Lord, shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that killeth any man shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that killeth a beast shall make it good, beast for beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man cause a blemish in his neighbor, as he hath done, so shall it be done to him—
speaker: Narrator

text: breach for breach, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. As he hath caused a blemish in a man, so shall it be done to him again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that killeth a beast, he shall restore it; and he that killeth a man, he shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall have one manner of law, as well for the stranger as for one of your own country; for I am the Lord your God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses spoke to the children of Israel, that they should bring forth him that had cursed out of the camp and stone him with stones. And the children of Israel did as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses on Mount Sinai, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak unto the children of Israel and say unto them: ‘When ye come into the land which I give you, then shall the land keep a sabbath unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six years thou shalt sow thy field, and six years thou shalt prune thy vineyard and gather in the fruit thereof,
speaker: Narrator

text: but in the seventh year shall be a sabbath of rest unto the land, a sabbath for the Lord; thou shalt neither sow thy field nor prune thy vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: That which groweth of its own accord of thy harvest thou shalt not reap, neither gather the grapes of thy vine undressed; for it is a year of rest unto the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sabbath of the land shall be meat for you: for thee, and for thy servant, and for thy maid, and for thy hired servant, and for thy stranger who sojourneth with thee;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for thy cattle and for the beasts that are in thy land shall all the increase thereof be meat.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And thou shalt number seven sabbaths of years unto thee, seven times seven years; and the space of the seven sabbaths of years shall be unto thee forty and nine years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou cause the trumpet of the jubilee to sound on the tenth day of the seventh month; on the Day of Atonement shall ye make the trumpet sound throughout all your land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout all the land unto all the inhabitants thereof. It shall be a jubilee unto you; and ye shall return every man unto his possession, and ye shall return every man unto his family.
speaker: Narrator

text: A jubilee shall that fiftieth year be unto you: ye shall not sow neither reap that which groweth of itself in it, nor gather the grapes in it of thy vine undressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is the jubilee; it shall be holy unto you; ye shall eat the increase thereof out of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘In the year of this jubilee ye shall return every man unto his possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thou sell aught unto thy neighbor or buyest aught of thy neighbor’s hand, ye shall not oppress one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the number of years after the jubilee thou shalt buy from thy neighbor, and according unto the number of years of the fruits he shall sell unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the multitude of years thou shalt increase the price thereof, and according to the fewness of years thou shalt diminish the price of it; for according to the number of the years of the fruits doth he sell unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not therefore oppress one another, but thou shalt fear thy God; for I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Therefore ye shall do My statutes, and keep My judgments and do them; and ye shall dwell in the land in safety.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the land shall yield her fruit, and ye shall eat your fill and dwell therein in safety.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if ye shall say, “What shall we eat the seventh year? Behold, we shall not sow nor gather in our increase.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will command My blessing upon you in the sixth year, and it shall bring forth fruit for three years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall sow the eighth year, and eat yet of old fruit until the ninth year; until her fruits come in ye shall eat of the old store.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land shall not be sold for ever, for the land is Mine; for ye are strangers and sojourners with Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in all the land of your possession ye shall grant a redemption for the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘If thy brother waxeth poor and hath sold away some of his possession, and if any of his kin come to redeem it, then shall he redeem that which his brother sold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the man have none to redeem it, and he himself is able to redeem it,
speaker: Narrator

text: then let him count the years of the sale thereof, and restore the overplus unto the man to whom he sold it, that he may return unto his possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he is not able to restore it to him, then that which is sold shall remain in the hand of him that hath bought it until the Year of Jubilee; and in the jubilee it shall go out, and he shall return unto his possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if a man sell a dwelling house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold; within a full year may he redeem it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it is not redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall be established for ever to him that bought it throughout his generations; it shall not go out in the jubilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the houses of the villages which have no wall round about them shall be counted as the fields of the country; they may be redeemed, and they shall go out in the jubilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, the cities of the Levites and the houses of the cities of their possession may the Levites redeem at any time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man purchase from the Levites, then the house that was sold and the city of his possession shall go out in the Year of Jubilee; for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the field of the suburbs of their cities may not be sold, for it is their perpetual possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if thy brother be waxed poor and hath fallen into ruin with thee, then thou shalt relieve him, yea, though he be a stranger or a sojourner, that he may live with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take thou no interest from him or increase; but fear thy God, that thy brother may live with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not give him thy money upon interest, nor lend him thy victuals for increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if thy brother who dwelleth by thee be waxed poor and is sold unto thee, thou shalt not compel him to serve as a bond servant;
speaker: Narrator

text: but as a hired servant and as a sojourner he shall be with thee, and shall serve thee unto the Year of Jubilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then shall he depart from thee, both he and his children with him, and shall return unto his own family, and unto the possession of his fathers shall he return.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they are My servants, whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt; they shall not be sold as bondmen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not rule over him with rigor, but shalt fear thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both thy bondmen and thy bondmaids, whom thou shalt have, shall be of the heathen who are round about you. From them shall ye buy bondmen and bondmaids.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover of the children of the strangers who sojourn among you, from them shall ye buy and from their families who are with you, whom they begot in your land; and they shall be your possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall take them as an inheritance for your children after you, to inherit them for a possession. They shall be your bondmen for ever. But over your brethren, the children of Israel, ye shall not rule one over another with rigor.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if a sojourner or stranger wax rich by thee, and thy brother who dwelleth by him wax poor and sell himself unto the stranger or sojourner by thee, or to the stock of the stranger’s family,
speaker: Narrator

text: after he is sold he may be redeemed again. One of his brethren may redeem him:
speaker: Narrator

text: either his uncle or his uncle’s son may redeem him, or any that is nigh of kin unto him of his family may redeem him; or if he is able, he may redeem himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall reckon with him that bought him from the year that he was sold to him unto the Year of Jubilee; and the price of his sale shall be according unto the number of years, according to the time of a hired servant shall it be with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there be yet many years behind, according unto them he shall give again the price of his redemption out of the money that he was bought for.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if there remain but few years unto the Year of Jubilee, then he shall count with him, and according unto his years shall he give him again the price of his redemption.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as a yearly hired servant shall he be with him, and the other shall not rule with rigor over him in thy sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he is not redeemed in these years, then he shall go out in the Year of Jubilee, both he and his children with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For unto Me the children of Israel are servants. They are My servants whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Ye shall make you no idols nor graven image, neither rear you up a standing image, neither shall ye set up any image of stone in your land to bow down unto it; for I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My sanctuary: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘If ye walk in My statutes and keep My commandments and do them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will give you rain in due season, and the land shall yield her increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your threshing shall reach unto the vintage, and the vintage shall reach unto the sowing time; and ye shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give peace in the land, and ye shall lie down, and none shall make you afraid; and I will rid evil beasts out of the land, neither shall the sword go through your land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: And five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall put ten thousand to flight; and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will have respect unto you, and make you fruitful and multiply you, and establish My covenant with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall eat old store, and bring forth the old because of the new.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set My tabernacle among you, and My soul shall not abhor you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will walk among you and will be your God, and ye shall be My people.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, that ye should not be their bondmen; and I have broken the bands of your yoke, and made you go upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘But if ye will not hearken unto Me and will not do all these commandments,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if ye shall despise My statutes, or if your soul abhor My judgments so that ye will not do all My commandments, but that ye break My covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: I also will do this unto you: I will even appoint over you terror, consumption, and the burning ague that shall consume the eyes and cause sorrow of heart; and ye shall sow your seed in vain, for your enemies shall eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set My face against you, and ye shall be slain before your enemies; they that hate you shall reign over you, and ye shall flee when none pursueth you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if ye will not yet for all this hearken unto Me, then I will punish you seven times more for your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will break the pride of your power; and I will make your heaven as iron and your earth as brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your strength shall be spent in vain; for your land shall not yield her increase, neither shall the trees of the land yield their fruits.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if ye walk contrary unto Me and will not hearken unto Me, I will bring seven times more plagues upon you according to your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also send wild beasts among you, which shall rob you of your children and destroy your cattle and make you few in number, and your highways shall be desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if ye will not be reformed by Me by these things, but will walk contrary unto Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: then will I also walk contrary unto you, and will punish you yet seven times for your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring a sword upon you that shall avenge the quarrel of My covenant; and when ye are gathered together within your cities I will send the pestilence among you, and ye shall be delivered into the hand of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when I have broken the staff of your bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall deliver you your bread again by weight; and ye shall eat and not be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if ye will not for all this hearken unto Me, but walk contrary unto Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will walk contrary unto you also in fury; and I, even I, will chastise you seven times for your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall eat the flesh of your sons, and the flesh of your daughters shall ye eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will destroy your high places, and cut down your images, and cast your carcasses upon the carcasses of your idols; and My soul shall abhor you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make your cities waste and bring your sanctuaries unto desolation, and I will not smell the savor of your sweet odors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring the land into desolation, and your enemies who dwell therein shall be astonished at it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will scatter you among the heathen, and will draw out a sword after you; and your land shall be desolate and your cities waste.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Then shall the land enjoy her sabbaths, as long as it lieth desolate and ye are in your enemies’ land; even then shall the land rest and enjoy her sabbaths.
speaker: Narrator

text: As long as it lieth desolate it shall rest, because it did not rest in your sabbaths when ye dwelt upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon them that are left alive of you, I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies; and the sound of a shaken leaf shall chase them; and they shall flee as fleeing from a sword, and they shall fall when none pursueth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall fall one upon another, as it were before a sword, when none pursueth; and ye shall have no power to stand before your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall perish among the heathen, and the land of your enemies shall eat you up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they that are left of you shall pine away in their iniquity in your enemies’ lands; and also in the iniquities of their fathers shall they pine away with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘If they shall confess their iniquity and the iniquity of their fathers, with their trespass which they trespassed against Me, and that also they have walked contrary unto Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that I also have walked contrary unto them and have brought them into the land of their enemies—if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled and they then accept the punishment of their iniquity,
speaker: Narrator

text: then will I remember My covenant with Jacob, and also My covenant with Isaac, and also My covenant with Abraham will I remember; and I will remember the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land also shall be left by them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths while she lieth desolate without them; and they shall accept the punishment of their iniquity, because, even because they despised My judgments and because their soul abhorred My statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet for all that, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not cast them away, neither will I abhor them, to destroy them utterly and to break My covenant with them; for I am the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will for their sakes remember the covenant of their ancestors, whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt in the sight of the heathen, that I might be their God: I am the Lord.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the statutes and judgments and laws which the Lord made between Himself and the children of Israel on Mount Sinai by the hand of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: ‘When a man shall make a singular vow, the persons shall be for the Lord by thy estimation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy estimation shall be of the male from twenty years old even unto sixty years old, even thy valuation shall be fifty shekels of silver, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it be a female, then thy valuation shall be thirty shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it be from five years old even unto twenty years old then thy valuation shall be for the male twenty shekels and for the female ten shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it be from a month old even unto five years old, then thy valuation shall be for the male five shekels of silver, and for the female thy valuation shall be three shekels of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it be from sixty years old and above, if it be a male, then thy valuation shall be fifteen shekels and for the female ten shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he be poorer than thy valuation, then he shall present himself before the priest and the priest shall value him; according to his ability who vowed shall the priest value him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if it be a beast whereof men bring an offering unto the Lord, all that any man giveth of such unto the Lord shall be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall not alter it nor change it, a good for a bad or a bad for a good; and if he shall at all change beast for beast, then it and the exchange thereof shall be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it be any unclean beast, which they do not offer as a sacrifice unto the Lord, then he shall present the beast before the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest shall value it, whether it be good or bad; as thou, who art the priest, valuest it, so shall it be.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he will at all redeem it, then he shall add a fifth part thereof unto thy valuation.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And when a man shall sanctify his house to be holy unto the Lord, then the priest shall evaluate it, whether it be good or bad; as the priest shall evaluate it, so shall it stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he that sanctified it will redeem his house, then he shall add a fifth part of the money of thy valuation unto it, and it shall be his.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And if a man shall sanctify unto the Lord some part of a field of his possession, then thy valuation shall be according to the seed thereof: a homer of barley seed shall be valued at fifty shekels of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he sanctify his field from the Year of Jubilee, according to thy valuation it shall stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he sanctify his field after the jubilee, then the priest shall reckon unto him the money according to the years that remain, even unto the Year of the Jubilee, and it shall be abated from thy valuation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he that sanctified the field will in any wise redeem it, then he shall add a fifth part of the money of thy valuation unto it, and it shall be assured to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he will not redeem the field or if he have sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the field, when it goeth out in the jubilee, shall be holy unto the Lord, as a field devoted; the possession thereof shall be the priest’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man sanctify unto the Lord a field which he hath bought, which is not of the fields of his possession,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the priest shall reckon unto him the worth of thy valuation, even unto the Year of the Jubilee; and he shall give thy valuation on that day as a holy thing unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the Year of the Jubilee the field shall return unto him from whom it was bought, even to him to whom the possession of the land did belong.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all thy valuations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs shall be the shekel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Only the firstborn of the beasts, which should be the Lord’S firstling, no man shall sanctify it; whether it be ox or sheep, it is the Lord’S.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it is of an unclean beast, then he shall redeem it according to thy valuation and shall add a fifth part of it thereto; or if it be not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to thy valuation.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Notwithstanding, no devoted thing that a man shall devote unto the Lord of all that he hath, both of man and beast, and of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed; every devoted thing is most holy unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: None devoted, which shall be devoted of men, shall be redeemed, but shall surely be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘And all the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land or of the fruit of the tree, is the Lord’S; it is holy unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man will at all redeem aught of his tithes, he shall add thereto a fifth part thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And concerning the tithe of the herd or of the flock, even of whatsoever passeth under the rod, a tenth shall be holy unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall not search whether it be good or bad, neither shall he change it; and if he change it at all, then both it and the change thereof shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the commandments which the Lord commanded Moses for the children of Israel on Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator
